intro: Quercus fuhsingensis, commonly known as the Fushing oak, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its lobed leaves and acorns. The plant is typically found in mountainous regions with a temperate climate. Its bark is smooth and grayish in color, becoming fissured with age. Quercus fuhsingensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
